dcterms:creator: Kalev Leetaru
Philip A. Schrodt
dcterms:description: The GDELT dataset is a Temporal Knowledge Graph (TKG) that records events happening in the world from news and articles in over 100 languages every 15 minutes. It includes a larger featured version with events from 2016 to 2020, where nodes represent actors and temporal edges represent point-time events.
dcterms:title: GDELT

dcterms:creator: Weihua Hu
Matthias Fey
Hongyu Ren
Maho Nakata
Yuxiao Dong
Jure Leskovec
dcterms:description: The MAG dataset is a homogeneous sub-graph of the heterogeneous MAG240M graph, representing a paper-paper citation network where each node is an academic paper and edges represent citations with timestamps.
dcterms:title: MAG

dcterms:creator: Emanuele Rossi
Ben Chamberlain
Fabrizio Frasca
Davide Eynard
Federico Monti
Michael Bronstein
dcterms:description: The Wikipedia dataset is a small-scale bipartite dynamic graph used for evaluating TGNN performance, where nodes represent entities and edges represent interactions over time.
dcterms:title: Wikipedia

dcterms:creator: Emanuele Rossi
Ben Chamberlain
Fabrizio Frasca
Davide Eynard
Federico Monti
Michael Bronstein
dcterms:description: The Reddit dataset is another small-scale bipartite dynamic graph used for evaluating TGNN performance, similar to the Wikipedia dataset.
dcterms:title: Reddit

dcterms:creator: Srijan Kumar
Xikun Zhang
Jure Leskovec
dcterms:description: The MOOC dataset is a small-scale dynamic graph representing interactions in a massive open online course environment, used for evaluating TGNN performance.
dcterms:title: MOOC

dcterms:creator: Srijan Kumar
Xikun Zhang
Jure Leskovec
dcterms:description: The LastFM dataset is a small-scale dynamic graph representing music listening interactions, used for evaluating TGNN performance.
dcterms:title: LastFM
